intro: Cyrtandra bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored heliconia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Heliconiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or yellow in color. Cyrtandra bicolor thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
